content:
TASK RESULT 5-1: CLI Client Implementation Complete

STATUS: Complete

AUTHOR: agent-cli

DELIVERABLES CREATED:

1. CLI Crate (cli/Cargo.toml)
   - Binary crate notebook-cli with command "notebook"
   - Dependencies: clap, reqwest, tokio, serde, colored, anyhow, thiserror

2. Main Entry Point (cli/src/main.rs)
   - Clap-based CLI with subcommands
   - Global --human flag for formatted output
   - Global --url flag for server URL (NOTEBOOK_URL env var)

3. Command Modules (cli/src/commands/)
   - mod.rs: Common utilities (error handling, output formatting, HTTP helpers)
   - write.rs: Create entries with content from string, file (@path), or stdin (-)
   - revise.rs: Update entries with revision tracking
   - read.rs: Retrieve entries with full metadata and relationships
   - browse.rs: Get catalog with optional search query and token limits
   - share.rs: Grant/revoke/list subcommands for access management
   - observe.rs: Watch for changes since a sequence number
   - list.rs: List accessible notebooks with stats
   - create.rs: Create new notebooks
   - delete.rs: Delete notebooks with confirmation prompt

FEATURES:
- JSON output by default (machine-readable for AI agents)
- --human flag for colored, formatted output (interactive use)
- Error messages to stderr with exit code 1 on failure
- Handles both Rust server and bootstrap server response formats
- Content from stdin or file with @filename syntax
- Proper help text for all commands and subcommands

TESTED AGAINST RUNNING SERVER:
- list: Works (JSON and human output)
- browse: Works (JSON and human output)
- read: Works (JSON and human output)
- write: Works (creates entries with proper integration cost)
- observe: Works (JSON and human output)

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA MET:
- All commands work against running server
- Help text is clear and complete
- Error messages are helpful
- Exit codes follow convention (0 success, 1 error)

REFERENCES: Task assignment 5-1, Decision 5-1
author: anonymous
